summary: This is a Palm Beach Police case report detailing an early 2002 investigation into Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein for suspected prostitution. It includes intelligence from West Palm Beach PD about Maxwell recruiting female students from Palm Beach Atlantic College, allegations of inappropriate touching by Epstein, and subsequent investigative steps including trash pulls and subpoenas. A later entry from 2008 notes Epstein's plea deal developments. This document is a compilation of police investigative supplements detailing surveillance, trash pulls, and intelligence gathering on Jeffrey Epstein's Palm Beach residence from 2004-2009. It includes details of alleged incidents with young females, the 2008 plea deal and sentencing, his 2009 release, and a 2020 email referencing Bill Clinton.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of a Palm Beach Police investigation for suspected prostitution. The report details his residence, vehicles, corporations, and allegations of inappropriate touching of young women recruited by Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Reportedly approached female students at Palm Beach Atlantic College to recruit them for work at her home, paying $200 per day. Described as secretive and working with Epstein.

persons.name: Sgt. 'lilt
persons.context: Passed on intelligence information regarding Maxwell and Epstein to the investigating detective on December 10, 2001.

persons.name: Allen McEniry
persons.role: Director of Security, Palm Beach Atlantic College
persons.context: Accompanied officers during a room search of a student's dormitory as part of the investigation.

persons.name: Eric Lowdermilk
persons.role: Residential Life staff, Palm Beach Atlantic College
persons.context: Requested a room search and handled student discipline related to the investigation.

persons.name: Sgt. Eichler
persons.role: Security Officer, Palm Beach Atlantic College
persons.context: Conducted a room search of a student's dormitory.

persons.name: Officer Ahlrich
persons.role: Security Officer, Palm Beach Atlantic College
persons.context: Conducted a room search of a student's dormitory.

persons.name: FBI agent
persons.context: Notified in 2008 about findings regarding Epstein's plea deal developments as reported in the Palm Beach Daily News.

persons.name: Jack A. Goldberger
persons.context: Epstein's attorney present at his 2008 plea hearing and who commented to media upon Epstein's release from jail in 2009.

persons.name: Guy Lewis
persons.context: Miami attorney representing Epstein in civil cases, present at the 2008 plea hearing.

persons.name: Howard J. Rubenstein
persons.context: Epstein's spokesman who issued a statement after the 2008 guilty plea.

persons.name: Brad Edwards
persons.context: Attorney representing alleged victims in federal civil suits against Epstein. He argued the 2008 plea deal was too lenient and contacted police in 2008.

persons.name: Judge Deborah Dale Pucillo
persons.context: Palm Beach Circuit Court judge who sentenced Epstein in June 2008.

persons.name: Judge Kenneth Marra
persons.context: U.S. District Judge who heard arguments from attorney Brad Edwards regarding the Epstein plea agreement in July 2008.

persons.name: Carmen Sloan
persons.context: Epstein's probation officer after his 2009 release, consulted by police on the terms of his house arrest.

persons.name: Igor
persons.context: Epstein's bodyguard/trainer observed walking with him in Palm Beach in August 2009 and present at a victim's deposition in October 2009.

persons.name: Detective Michelle Pagan
persons.context: Lead detective investigating Epstein for sexual battery of a 14-year-old female. Requested surveillance and trash pulls.

persons.name: Off. Irion
persons.context: Officer who filed an intelligence report after being flagged down by a taxi driver who dropped off two young females at Epstein's residence.

persons.name: Officer M.
persons.context: Officer who filed an intelligence report regarding a property manager's observations at Epstein's residence.

persons.name: Tony Higgins
persons.context: Palm Beach Sanitation Supervisor who assisted police in arranging trash pulls from Epstein's residence.

persons.name: Jeff Williams
persons.context: Palm Beach sanitation employee who collected and turned over Epstein's trash to police on multiple occasions.

persons.name: Sgt. Dan Szarszewski
persons.context: Police sergeant notified of information from a potential witness in September 2005.

persons.name: Capt. Gudger
persons.context: Police captain who determined a potential witness should be interviewed at a later date.

persons.name: Bill Clinton
persons.context: Referenced in a 2020 external email forwarded to police, calling him "Epstein's Buddy" and "Guest Of Honour" at parties.

persons.name: Chris Hepburn
persons.context: External individual who sent a 2020 email to police referencing Bill Clinton's association with Epstein.

connections.description: Described as working together at the El Brillo Way residence, with Maxwell recruiting young women and both being secretive about activities. They shared phone lines and addresses.
Maxwell recruited female students from Palm Beach Atlantic College to answer phones at her home, paying them $200 per day in cash.
At least two of the recruited girls complained about Epstein touching them inappropriately. One student reported Epstein had her take her top off for a massage, which made her uncomfortable.
Maxwell is listed as an associate of Epstein in the police file. Her name was found on notepaper in Epstein's trash.
Goldberger was Epstein's defense attorney, present at his plea hearing and speaking to media on his behalf upon release.
Igor is identified as Epstein's bodyguard/trainer, accompanying him during walks and to a victim's deposition.
Adversarial legal relationship; Edwards represented alleged victims suing Epstein and challenged his plea deal.
A 2020 email forwarded to police alleges Clinton was a "Guest Of Honour" at Epstein's parties.

events.title: Initial Intelligence Received
events.description: OCVAN unit received intelligence from West Palm Beach PD concerning Ghislaine Maxwell recruiting young women from Palm Beach Atlantic College.

events.title: Trash Pulls Conducted
events.description: Investigators conducted intermittent trash pulls at 358 El Brillo Way, discovering items including nude photographs, lists of female names with ages/descriptions, massage directories, phone bills, and references to a weapon on the property.

events.title: Investigative Subpoena for Phone Records
events.description: An investigative subpoena was completed requesting all incoming and outgoing phone lines for 358 El Brillo Way.

events.title: PBAC Dorm Room Search
events.description: Palm Beach Atlantic College security conducted a room search of a student's dorm, finding alcohol and papers with adult website addresses and information about adult work paying $2,200 weekly.

events.title: Interviews with Recruited Students
events.description: Detectives interviewed two students who confirmed being approached by Maxwell and working at the residence. They felt something 'weird' was occurring but did not observe anything illegal at the time.

events.title: Plea Deal News Report
events.description: A Palm Beach Daily News article revealed Epstein's plea hearing was postponed. He had agreed to an 18-month imprisonment and house arrest deal but was negotiating the sex offender registration requirement.

events.title: Plea Hearing Postponement Revealed
events.description: A Palm Beach Daily News article reveals Epstein's plea hearing was postponed until March 2008. It details a tentative agreement for an 18-month imprisonment and lifetime sex offender registration, which Epstein was trying to renegotiate.

events.title: Epstein Pleads Guilty and is Sentenced
events.description: Epstein pleads guilty to solicitation of prostitution and procurement of a minor for prostitution. He is sentenced to 18 months in Palm Beach County Jail, followed by 12 months house arrest, and must register as a sex offender for life.

events.title: Victims Challenge Plea Deal in Federal Court
events.description: Attorney Brad Edwards argues in U.S. District Court that the plea agreement was too lenient and made without victim consultation, alleging it shielded Epstein from federal prosecution for abusing many other girls.

events.title: Epstein Released from Jail
events.description: Epstein is released from Palm Beach County Jail after serving less than 13 months of his 18-month sentence. He begins 12 months of house arrest/probation at his Palm Beach home.

events.title: Alleged Deposition Intimidation Incident
events.description: Epstein and his bodyguard Igor allegedly appear at a victim's deposition, with Epstein staring and smirking at the victim, causing her to burst into tears and leave. This potentially violates a no-contact order.

events.title: Epstein's Death Reported
events.description: News outlets report Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his Manhattan jail cell, with his death investigated as an apparent suicide. He had been arrested on federal charges in July 2019.

events.title: Video Surveillance and Trash Pulls Begin
events.description: Police begin intensive surveillance and trash pulls at Epstein's residence, collecting items including mail, notes with girls' names, and a broken piece of a sexual toy.

locations: 358 El Brillo Way, Palm Beach, FL 33480
OCVAN Unit, 345 S. County Rd., Palm Beach, FL
358 El Brillo Way, Palm Beach, Florida (Epstein's primary residence mentioned throughout)
Manhattan Correctional Center, New York, NY
Wellington Green Mall (where a witness worked at Abercrombie and Fitch)
keyFacts: In late 2001, Ghislaine Maxwell was reportedly recruiting young, unmarried female students from Palm Beach Atlantic College to answer phones at her Palm Beach home for $200 per day in cash.
At least two of the recruited girls complained about Jeffrey Epstein touching them inappropriately. One student reported Epstein had her take her top off for a massage.

Trash pulls at Epstein's residence in early 2002 revealed nude photographs of women, lists of female names with ages and descriptions titled 'People that I want you to meet', massage directories, and references to a weapon on the property.
The investigation was initially classified as 'UNFOUNDED' for prostitution, with no illegal activity directly reported or detected at the time, though it was kept for intelligence purposes.
A 2008 news article noted Epstein's plea deal negotiations, including an 18-month imprisonment and house arrest, but a dispute over lifetime sex offender registration.
Police conducted extensive surveillance and trash pulls at Epstein's Palm Beach home from 2005-2005, finding notes with girls' names and broken sexual toys.

Epstein's 2008 plea deal resulted in an 18-month jail sentence and lifetime sex offender registration, but was criticized by victims' attorneys for being too lenient and shielding him from federal prosecution for other alleged victims.
After his 2009 release, Epstein was observed violating the terms of his house arrest by walking on the beach and was allegedly involved in an incident intimidating a victim at her deposition.
A 2020 email forwarded to Palm Beach Police references former President Bill Clinton as "Epstein's Buddy" and a "Guest Of Honour" at parties, showing continued public interest in the associations.

The document details multiple earlier police intelligence reports from 2004-2005, including tips about young girls being dropped at Epstein's home and a witness claiming he "has many young girls come over."
